intro: Acosmium praeclarum, commonly known as the splendid acosmium, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Its fruit is a dry, capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to habitat loss, Acosmium praeclarum is considered endangered and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
